children.subject: Yes, please apply in Fall 2021 when you have CS 61C in progress. PNP would not impact being able to apply; PNP was approved for Sp20, F20 and Sp21, this is listed in our webpage: https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/honors
So if I'm declaring this semester but will take 61c in the fall, that means I apply in the fall right? Also would P/NP in any of the classes listed impact being able to apply?

We do not yet know whether students will be able to take classes for PNP this summer for requirements for the EECS Honors Program. L&S has approved this for various requirements within the college, but the departments need to determine whether they will accept PNP for programs like the EECS Honors Program as well as the major and minor courses.

Please plan to take any courses for the EECS Honors Program/EECS/CS major for a letter grade this summer and we will post information on the EECS 101 Piazza and our website as soon as possible.
Can summer 2021 classes be counted for the EECS Honors Requirements if taken P/NP?
You can take more than the required 10 units of breadth, but for purposes of the program please only choose to list up to 3-4 courses for your breadth.

On the application it says "List all of your proposed breadth courses: (Minimum 10 units. Please include Course Title and units, do not exceed 12 units..." Does this mean that we are not permitted to have more than 12 units of breadth, or do just choose 12 units to report here?

history.content:
EECS Honors Program Info Session
Tuesday 4/20 2-3pm PST
Recording of session: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ub8LX04upMg

The EECS Honors Program is open to students declared in EECS or Computer Science. Join me to learn more about the program.

***Application deadline: Wednesday, May 5th at 4pm PST*** 


Unable to attend? No worries, all information, application, FAQ, and slides are available here: https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/honors

For questions, please email Andrea Mejia Valencia at mejiavalencia@eecs.berkeley.edu.
